author: COMSOL
description: In this first half of a two-part example, a 2D model of a trench-gate IGBT is built, which will be extended to 3D in the second half. In general, it is the most efficient to start with a 2D model to make sure everything works as expected, before extending it to 3D. The Caugheyâ€“Thomas mobility model is combined with the Klaassen unified mobility model to account for velocity saturation and phonon, impurity, and carrier-carrier scattering. The contact resistance option of metal contact boundary conditions is used to implement the mixed-mode simulation with parasitic resistance at the collector and emitter as mentioned in the reference paper. The computed collector current density as a function of the collector voltage agrees reasonably well with the published result.
label: trench_gate_igbt_2d.mph
